metadata.description: Customer, plant, and product master data for simulation

relationships.plant_to_customer: n:1 (each plant belongs to one customer)
relationships.product_to_plant: n:1 (each product is produced at one plant)
relationships.simulation_scope: One plant at a time - simulation directory is plant-specific

customer.id: Unique customer identifier (used in directory naming and reporting)
customer.name: Customer company name
customer.description: Brief description of customer's main business
customer.contact: Customer contact information for reporting purposes

plant.id: Unique plant identifier within customer organization
plant.name: Plant name (used in directory naming and reporting)
plant.available_containers: Number of transport containers/carriers available for batch transport (affects WIP capacity)

production_schedule.weeks_per_year: Number of production weeks per year (accounting for holidays/maintenance)
production_schedule.days_per_week: Number of production days per week
production_schedule.shifts_per_day: Number of work shifts per day
production_schedule.hours_per_shift: Duration of one shift in hours

production_targets.annual: List of annual production targets per product
production_targets.target_quantity: Target number of pieces to produce annually

products.plant_id: Reference to plant where this product is manufactured
products.name: Product name

properties.surface_area_mm2: Total surface area in square millimeters
properties.pieces_per_batch: Number of product pieces that fit in one batch/carrier

quality_requirements.coating_thickness_min_um: Minimum acceptable coating thickness in micrometers
quality_requirements.coating_thickness_max_um: Maximum acceptable coating thickness in micrometers

simulation_usage.reporting: Customer and plant info displayed in all reports for identification
simulation_usage.product_batching: Production.csv references product_id; pieces_per_batch determines batch size
simulation_usage.capacity_planning: Production targets and schedule used for long-term capacity analysis

notes: Simulation always runs for ONE plant at a time
Multiple products can be processed in the same simulation run
Each product has a treatment_program which references treatment_program_XXX.csv files
pieces_per_batch determines how many product units are loaded into one batch carrier
available_containers limits the maximum number of batches in-process (WIP capacity constraint)
Annual production hours = weeks_per_year × days_per_week × shifts_per_day × hours_per_shift
Product surface_area and weight may be used for chemical consumption calculations
